tit.e: Yata no Kagami mirror (the sacred/divine mirror)
tit.cmt: eliminated "mirror" and description in parenthesis since this is the title

sen.j: 八咫鏡（やたのかがみ）は三種の神器の一つである鏡である。
sen.e: Yata no Kagami is a mirror, one of the Sanshu noJingi (Three Imperial Regalia).
Yata no Kagami is a mirror and one of the Sanshu no Jingi (Three Imperial Regalia).
sen.cmt: changed comma to "and"
sen.e: Yata no Kagami is a mirror and one of the Sanshu no Jingi (Three Imperial Regalia).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 『日本書紀』本文には「真経津鏡（まふつのかがみ）とも言う」との記述がある。
sen.e: In "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), there is a description, 'the mirror was also referred as Mafutsu no Kagami mirror'.
sen.cmt: mirror' 鏡を補いました。
sen.e: In the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), there is a description stating that "the mirror was also referred to as Mafutsu no Kagami mirror."
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: In the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), there is a description stating that 'the mirror was also referred to as Mafutsu no Kagami mirror.'

sen.j: 日本神話によれば、天照大神の天岩戸の際に石凝姥命が作った。
sen.e: According toJapanese Mythology, it was made by a goddess Ishikoridome-no-mikoto when Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun goddess) hid behind the Ama no Iwato, the Gate of the Celestial Rock Cave.

According to Japanese mythology, the mirror was made by the goddess Ishikoridome no mikoto when Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun goddess) was hiding behind the Ama no Iwato, the Gate of the Celestial Rock Cave.
sen.cmt: made "mythology" lowercase; changed "it" to "the mirror"; eliminated hyphens in "Ishikoridome no mikoto"; fixed grammar
sen.e: According to Japanese mythology, the mirror was made by the goddess Ishikoridome no mikoto when Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun goddess) was hiding behind the Ama no Iwato, the Gate of the Celestial Rock Cave.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 天照大神が岩戸を細めに開けた時、この鏡で天照大神自身を映した。
sen.e: When Amaterasu Omikami slightly opened the rock gate, the mirror reflected Amaterasu Omikami herself.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When Amaterasu Omikami made a narrow opening in the rock gate, she saw a reflection of herself in the mirror.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処; fixed grammar
sen.e: When Amaterasu Omikami made a narrow opening in the rock gate, she saw a reflection of herself in the mirror.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そして、興味を持たせて外に引き出し、再び世は明るくなった。
sen.e: It attracted her interest so that she came out of the cave.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Attracting her interest, the reflection made her come out of the cave and the world became bright once more.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処; combined this sentence with the next one to reduce fragmentation and fixed grammar accordingly;
sen.e: Attracting her interest, the reflection made her come out of the cave and the world became bright once more.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 天孫降臨の際、天照大神からニニギに授けられた。
sen.e: At the time of Tensonkorin (the descent to earth of the grandson of the sun goddess), Amaterasu Omikami gave Ninigi (a god, the grandson of Amarerasu Omikami) the mirror.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During Tensonkorin (the descent to earth by the grandson of the sun goddess), Amaterasu Omikami gave the mirror to her grandson Ninigi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処; rearranged sentence to read more naturally; eliminated the second description in parenthesis since it was redundant and added "grandson" before "Ninigi";
sen.e: During Tensonkorin (the descent to earth by the grandson of the sun goddess), Amaterasu Omikami gave the mirror to her grandson Ninigi.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: この鏡を天照大神自身だと思って祀るようにとの神勅（宝鏡奉斎の神勅）が下された。
sen.e: She issued Shinchoku, divine decree (Hokyo Hosai no Shinchoku, literally "decree to enshrine the treasure mirror") that the mirror was to be enshrined as her own reflection.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: She issued a Shinchoku, a divine decree (Hokyo Hosai no Shinchoku, literally meaning "a decree to enshrine the treasure mirror") to have the mirror enshrined with her own reflection.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: She issued a Shinchoku, a divine decree (Hokyo Hosai no Shinchoku, literally meaning "a decree to enshrine the treasure mirror") to have the mirror enshrined with her own reflection.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 咫（あた）は円周の単位で、0.8 尺である。
sen.e: Ata (ata of Y-ata no Kagami) was unit for circumference and one ata was equivarant to 24cm (approx.).
sen.cmt: 「あた」を説明するため、八咫鏡をくわえました。
sen.e: An 'ata' (the 'ata' coming after the 'y' of 'Yata') was a unit for measuring circumference, with one ata being equivalent to approximately twenty-four centimeters.
sen.cmt: changed "24cm" to "twenty-four centimeters"; changed description in parenthesis to be more understandable; equivarant→equivalent; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: An 'ata' (the 'ata' coming after the 'y' of 'Yata') was a unit for measuring circumference, with one ata being equivalent to approximately twenty-four centimeters.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 径 1 尺の円 (数学)の円周を 4 咫としていた。
sen.e: The circumference of 24cm diameter round was regarded as 4ata.
Having a diameter of twenty-four centimeters was regarded as a circumference of four 'ata.'
sen.cmt: changed "24cm" to "twenty-four centimeters"; changed "4" to "four"; fixed grammar to read more understandably;
sen.e: Having a diameter of twenty-four centimeters was regarded as a circumference of four 'ata.'
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: したがって「八咫鏡」は直径 2 尺（46センチメートル 前後）の円鏡を意味する。
sen.e: Therefore, Yata no Kagami designates a 46cm diameter round mirror.
This means that the Yata no Kagami was a round mirror forty-six centimeters in diameter.
sen.cmt: changed "46" to "forty-six"; fixed grammar
sen.e: This means that the Yata no Kagami was a round mirror forty-six centimeters in diameter.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 元々は祭祀に用いる鏡を表す一般名詞であったものが、後に三種の神器の一つである鏡を指す固有名詞になったと考えられる。
sen.e: It is considered that Yata no Kagami was originally a common noun that signified a mirror used in the Shinto rituals but, afterward, turn to a proper noun to signify the mirror of Three Imperial Regalia.
Yata no Kagami is thought to have originally been a common noun signifiying a mirror used in Shinto rituals, then later becoming a proper noun to specify the mirror of the Three Imperial Regalia.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Yata no Kagami is thought to have originally been a common noun signifying a mirror used in Shinto rituals, then later becoming a proper noun to specify the mirror of the Three Imperial Regalia.
sen.cmt: スペル

sen.j: 八咫鏡の所在には諸説ある。
sen.e: There are several theories about the location of Yata no Kagami: the mirror is still placed in the Ise Kotai-jingu Shrine, or the mirror in the Naishidokoro (Kashikidokoro)(in the Three Shrines in the Imperial Court) was, at the defeat of the Taira clan, once sunk offshore in Dan no Ura with Emperor Antoku but was collected by MINTMOTO no Yoshitsune with Yasakani no magatama (comma-shaped jewel), or the mirrow was moved to another place before the defeat of the Taira clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There are several theories about the location of the Yata no Kagami.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処; split this sentence off from the description of the theories;
sen.e: There are several theories about the location of the Yata no Kagami.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 伊勢神宮の皇大神宮に変わらず安置されているとする説、宮中の内侍所（宮中三殿）にあったものが、平家滅亡の際、安徳天皇とともにひとたび壇ノ浦に沈んだものを源義経が八尺瓊勾玉とともに回収したとする説、平家滅亡前に他方へ遷したとする説などがある。
sen.e: The first theory claims that it is still placed in the Ise Kotai-Jingu Shrine, while a second theory argues that the mirror placed in the Nashidokoro (Kashidokoro) (the Three Shrines in the Imperial Court) was sunk offshore in the battle of Dannoura (the final battle of the Heike-Genji wars) with Emperor Antoku at the defeat of the Taira clan but later collected along with the Yasakani no magatama (comma-shape jewel [another of the Three Imperial Regalia]) by MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune, and then another theory describes that the mirror was moved to another place before the defeat of the Taira clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処; changed "Dan no Ura" to "Dannoura" and added a description; mirrow→mirror; added description for "Yasakani no magatama"; MINTMOTO→MINAMOTO; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: The first theory claims that it is still placed in the Ise Kotai-Jingu Shrine, while a second theory argues that the mirror placed in the Naishidokoro (Kashidokoro) (the Three Shrines in the Imperial Court) was sunk offshore in the battle of Dannoura (the final battle of the Heike-Genji wars) with Emperor Antoku at the defeat of the Taira clan but later collected along with the Yasakani no magatama (comma-shape jewel [another of the Three Imperial Regalia]) by MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune, and then another theory describes that the mirror was moved to another place before the defeat of the Taira clan.
sen.cmt: スペル

sen.j: 伊勢神宮の内宮に奉安されている鏡は、神道五部書等によれば「八葉」と書かれている。
sen.e: According to "Shito Gobusho" (five-volume apologia of Shinto) and others, the word 'Hachiyo' is written on the mirror that was enshrined in the Inner Shrine of Ise.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to documents such as the "Shito Gobusho" (a five-volume apologia of Shinto), the word 'Hachiyo' is written on the mirror that was enshrined in the Inner Shrine of Ise.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処; added "documents such as the" for "等";
sen.e: According to documents such as the "Shito Gobusho" (a five-volume apologia of Shinto), the word 'Hachiyo' is written on the mirror that was enshrined in the Inner Shrine of Ise.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 原田大六は福岡県前原市にある平原遺跡出土の内行花文鏡と同じ形のものではなかったかと推定している。
sen.e: Dairoku HARADA presumes the mirror had the same shape as that of Naiko Kamonkyo Mirror, which was excavated from the Hirabaru ruin in Maebara City, Fukuoka Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Dairoku HARADA estimates that the mirror had the same shape of the Naiko Kamonkyo Mirror, which was excavated from the Hirabaru ruins in Maebara City, Fukuoka Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処; changed "presumes" to "estimates" and fixed grammar accordingly; fixed grammar
sen.e: Dairoku HARADA estimates that the mirror had the same shape of the Naiko Kamonkyo Mirror, which was excavated from the Hirabaru ruins in Maebara City, Fukuoka Prefecture.

sen.j: 尚、内宮の鏡は、明治天皇の観覧後、封印されたとされる。
sen.e: The mirror of the Inner Shrine of Ise is said to be sealed after the Meiji Emperor viewed.
The mirror in the Inner Shrine of Ise is said to have been sealed after being viewed by the Meiji Emperor.

sen.j: 宮中で大内裏の内侍所にあったことから、天照大神は「内侍所」と別称されることもあった。
sen.e: Amarerasu Omicami was also referred to as 'Naishidokoro' since the mirror was placed in Naishidokoro in the Imperial Palace.
Amaterasu Omikami is also referred to as 'Naishidokoro' since the mirror was placed in the Naishidokoro in the Imperial Palace.
sen.cmt: Amarerasu Omicami→Amaterasu Omikami; changed "was" to "is";
